ygData.subject: Re: New Char
ygData.msgSnippet: Also items that add +9 to your int ... From: John Cuyle [mailto:johncuyle@iname.com] Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 9:17 AM To: eq_wizards@onelist.com Subject:
ygData.messageBody:
Also items that add +9 to your int


-----Original Message-----
From: John Cuyle [mailto:johncuyle@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 9:17 AM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: New Char


From: "John Cuyle" <johncuyle@...>


Then again there are items that add one or 2 to int, and having a little
over may make it so a +2 mana ring bumps you to the next level.
----- Original Message -----
From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 7:05 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: New Char


> From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
>
> I don't think that is nessesary, You still have more intellegence
than a
maxed
> out human wizard or a maxed out high elf wizard, and both of them are
very
> usable class/race combo's. I'd keep him, but if you do start a new
character my
> suggestion would be to make the intellegence divisable by 5. I saw
the
equation
> for calculating mana on the message boards during beta, and although I
can't
> remember exactly what it was; I do rember that they divided your Int
by 5
when
> calculating it. Lastly I would put any extra skill points in either
dexterity
> or wisdom. Dexterity will keep you from getting interupted as often
and
wisdom
> will provide you with some magic resistance.
>
> > From: "Thomas Sommer" <sommer_thomas@...>
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > maybe you can help me:
> >
> > I've created a darkelf wizard und spent 20 points to INT, 5 points
to
STR
> > and 5 points to CHARISMA (stupid, I don't know why i did that). Do
you
> > think it's worth to recreate my character spending 25 points to INT
and
5
> > to AGILITY?
> > Or do you think the stats are ok and I will have no major
disadvantages
in
> > the future? By the way I'm lvl 8 now.
> >
> > These are my stats:
> >
> > STR 65 STA 75 AGI 90 DEX 75 WIS 83 INT 129 CHA 65
> >
> > Greetings
> >
> > Sinadin
> >
> > !
>
>
